result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Detrail Foster

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to cases 19CF3990 & 21CF2351 for the purpose of sentencing.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for today's proceedings.  Case remains calendared for speedy jury trial 4/11/22.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp. 4/19

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LMC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Alonzo Detrail Foster in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:03 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
